humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 'four of six (4/6) lymph nodes are positive for metastatic tumor.' This corresponds to New Rule 12, which states that N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage of cancer is determined by the involvement of lymph nodes. In this report, it is stated that 'four of six (4/6) lymph nodes are positive for metastatic tumor.' This indicates that the cancer has spread to at least 4 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N2 stage. The substaging information, such as the presence of extracapsular extension, does not affect the main N stage classification.
